general_advisory: Complete transplanting of winter vegetable crops. Use low cost polythene cover above the vegetable nursery to avoid poor germination due to low temperature. For early and maximum yield in Cole crops spray Gibberellic Acid. Do proper field surveillance for pests and diseases regularly. In winter during cold or night hours, farmers should keep doors, windows, and open spaces in cow sheds covered with polythene or gunny bag curtains.

advisory: Post harvesting stage - Rodent control: If 'Rodent/Rats' problem is noticed, take necessary steps to eliminate them.
Vegetative stage - Pest management: Control Tobacco Caterpillar by setting up traps and using appropriate sprays.
Vegetative stage - Aphids and Thrips control: Use neem-based pesticide for infestation management.
Vegetative stage - Diamond Back Moth infestation: Use neem-based pesticide for control.
Planting stage - Optimum time for planting. Use disease-free suckers for planting.
Ensure heat provision for chicks during night hours. Maintain cleanliness in poultry house.
